Organized and Orderly Servants of God


References


n/a


Questions




How do the following scriptures indicate that Jehovah is organized? (
Ps 103:20, 21
; 
Isa 40:25, 26
; 
Eze 1:12
; 
Mt 24:45
)


How is Jehovah’s organizational ability balanced with his quality of happiness? (1Co 14:33; 1Ti 1:11)


How does Paul’s first letter to the Corinthian congregation show that the Christian congregation is organized?


Show how the congregations of the first century were organized theocratically.


In what way is the Christian congregation today organized theocratically, and how is that possible?


How can elders be both organized and happy in their own activities and in directing the work of others? (Pr 11:17; Ec 3:12, 13)


While good organization helps in the smooth functioning of the congregation, what danger exists if you become preoccupied with organizational matters, procedures, and efficiency?


In harmony with Romans 12:8, what should the coordinator of the body of elders cultivate in relation to his preparation for elders’ meetings?


How does a coordinator go about compiling the agenda for an elders’ meeting?


During elders’ meetings, what should the coordinator do so that he can preside “in real earnest”? (Ro 12:8; 1Ti 2:8)


What responsibility do you have when the body assigns you to follow through on something?




During elders’ meetings, what benefits result when you:

 a) do not insist that your personal viewpoint be adopted when issues are being discussed?

 b) listen carefully to the comments of other elders even when you may feel strongly about how a matter

 c) should be handled? (Pr 18:17; Ac 15:1, 2, 24, 25; Ro 12:3, 10)

 d) speak only when you have something meaningful to add on the point under discussion? (Pr 10:19)  






Who make up a Branch Committee and what do the committee’s responsibilities include?




What responsibilities rest upon the circuit overseer as suggested by Acts 20:26-32 and 1 Timothy 4:11-16?


How do elders show earnestness when it comes to the circuit overseer’s visit?


How can you cooperate with the coordinator as he prepares for the visit of the circuit overseer?

References


n/a


Questions




Why did Asaph become disheartened? What did he come to understand? (Ps 73)


In what ways can elders ensure that our meetings are an encouragement? In harmony with what is being dispensed by the faithful slave? Lively and interesting?


What is the objective of the Public Meeting? (Lu 8:18; Ac 18:4; 19:9, 10; 1Th 5:21)


How does your body of elders decide which public talks should be presented to the congregation?


What should be done if a visiting speaker fails to arrive before the meeting begins?


What does the chairman’s assignment include?


What can be done to help brothers improve as public speakers?


Explain the value of the Watchtower Study and what each of us can do to benefit from it.


Explain how the Watchtower Study is to be conducted.


What can the conductor do to ensure that he manages the time effectively?


What are some objectives of the midweek meeting?


How will the Treasures from God’s Word section enhance our understanding of Bible accounts?


How are various presentations to be handled during the second part of the meeting, Apply Yourself to the Field Ministry?


What should the coordinator of the body of elders consider when assigning parts for the Living as Christians section of the midweek meeting? 


Why should there be good communication between the coordinator and the Life and Ministry Meeting overseer when scheduling assignments?


How is the Congregation Bible Study conducted?


Why is it vital that no parts of the meeting go overtime?


What should be accomplished at the meeting for field service?


How long should meetings for service be? Why is it important to stay within the allotted time?


How should a sister conduct a meeting for field service? What can the service overseer do to minimize potentially awkward situations?


Preparing well for all meetings will have what beneficial effect on each one’s spirituality? (Eph 4:11-13)

Explain how Jehovah is the source of all spiritual enlightenment. (Ps 43:3; Isa 42:6, 7; 51:4)


What was Jesus’ role in illuminating Jehovah’s purposes? (Joh 9:5; 12:35; 2Co 4:6)


How is divine wisdom evidenced by the gradual revelation of truth? (Pr 4:18; Joh 16:12, 13)


How did responsible brothers in the first century respond to progressive spiritual enlightenment? (Ac 15:7-12)


Who would be the ones to “shine” with spiritual insight during the time of the end referred to at Daniel 12:3, 4? Explain how shining brightly differs at Matthew 13:43.


When making decisions concerning the medical use of blood, how might Christians please Jehovah?


How do doctrinal refinements build your faith and confidence in Jehovah and his organization?


How can we show continued appreciation for flashes of spiritual light? How do we let our light shine as Christians? (Ps 97:11; Mt 5:14-16; Eph 5:15; Heb 13:15; 1Pe 3:15, 16)

What is the value of “See Glossary,” which also appears in some footnotes? (Mt 24:3; Mr 8:34)

On what basis were the marginal references selected?


How can we make efficient use of the “Bible Words Index”?


How might the entry “Comfort” in the index be used on a shepherding visit?

Why is the divine name missing from many translations?


Why does the New World Translation use the form “Jehovah”?


What is the meaning of the name Jehovah?


What reasons support the use of the divine name in the Christian Greek Scriptures?


Demonstrate how the chart “Prophets and Kings of Judah and of Israel” can help us to understand Bible accounts accurately.


Explain the value of “The Four Gospels Set in Chronological Order.”

 a) What information does the “Key to Maps” provide?

What helpful information do we find under “Key to Maps”?


How might you use the section “The Message of the Bible”?


Give examples of how the features of Appendix B can be used in personal study, for meeting preparation, or with your Bible student.


How is the outline feature at the beginning of each Bible book helpful?

docs.text:
Your Role in Promoting Christian Unity


References


n/a 


Questions




What role does Jesus play in God’s purpose to unify heaven and earth? (Eph 1:20-23)


Why is unity within the Christian congregation important, and how do the following scriptures show that there would be unity among us? (Isa 2:2-4; Zec 8:23; 1Co 1:10; Re 7:9, 14, 15)


What is key for a body of elders to be able to work together in unity?


Use the following scriptures to show how an elder demonstrates submission to Christ’s headship. (Joh 7:16-18; Mt 24:45-47; Heb 13:17; 1Co 4:6; Ro 12:10b; Jas 1:19; Mt 11:28-30; Joh 21:15-17; 1Pe 5:1-3, 5; Jas 1:5)


According to Hebrews 13:7, how can your example in contributing to unity influence the congregation, and what lessons can be learned from this?


What effect does a unified body of elders have on those associated with the congregation? (1Co 14:25, 33, 40)


Why is humility an important quality for elders?


In what ways does having a superior attitude undermine one’s effectiveness as an elder? (Ro 14:4; 1Co 13:4, 5)


What are some ways an elder could become guilty of abusing his power in the congregation?


Why should an elder avoid showing favoritism?


Why should overseers not talk down to publishers? (Pr 16:18; 22:4; 1Pe 5:5, 6)


Why is it unloving to fail to correct fellow elders when they are not properly caring for their responsibilities? What balance is needed?


What should we keep in mind when giving counsel to others?


How does a liberal use of the Bible and our Christian publications when counseling have a unifying effect on the congregation and on our fellow elders? (2Ti 3:16, 17)


Why should overseers be cautious when personal likes or dislikes may be a basis for counsel?


How does following organizational procedures and instructions have a unifying effect on others?


How does it promote unity when as elder is unselfish in caring for his responsibilities? (Ac 20:34, 35; Heb 13:17)


According to Psalm 29:11 and Isaiah 60:17, what is the principal reason we can enjoy unity in the Christian congregation?

References


n/a 


Questions




Before meeting to consider recommending brothers as ministerial servants or elders, what should be done by individual elders? What are we looking for in a spiritual man?


In addition to the Scriptures, why should we consider the information published by the faithful and discreet slave?


Discuss the meaning and importance of each qualification. (1Ti 3:1-13; Tit 1:5-9)


In what manner are elders and ministerial servants appointed by holy spirit? (Ac 20:28)


While holding to a high Scriptural standard, why must overseers be reasonable when considering those who qualify to serve as elders and ministerial servants?


Why is it good to be thorough in obtaining background information for brothers being recommended? (1Th 5:21; 1Ti 5:22)


What kind of information should be compiled when brothers have:  

 a) previously been involved in wrongdoing?

 b) been separated or unscripturally divorced?

 c) served in an appointed position in the past?  


Why is it good for elders to work with a recommended brother and his family in field service, visit him at home, and talk with him about his spiritual goals? (Lu 6:45)

Develop Teaching Ability


References


n/a 


Questions




What is a teacher?


Why is Jehovah called the “Grand Instructor”? (Isa 30:20; 54:13; Heb 8:10)


From the following examples, what should we learn from Jehovah about effective teaching? (Ge 18:20-32; Job 38:4, 8, 31; Isa 40:26, Isa 44:14-17; Jon 4:9-11)


Why is teaching an important part of our service to the congregation? (1Ti 3:2; 4:16)


Why was Jesus such an outstanding teacher? (Mt 22:36-40)


Discuss the following scriptures that made Jesus an effective teacher. (Mt 4:4, 7, 10; Joh 17:14; Mt 16:5-12; 22:42-45; Mt 13:47-50; Lu 15:3-10; Mt 18:1-5; Mr 4:10, 13-20, 34; Lu 24:32)


What effect did Jesus’ teachings have on others? (Joh 7:45, 46)


How does God’s spirit teach?


Why would it be beneficial to review the Ministry School book, page 61, paragraph 3, before handling any teaching assignment?


To teach effectively from an outline, what must be done first?


Using Public Talk Outline No. 36, “Is This Life All There Is?,” answer the following:

 a) How is the “Note to the speaker” helpful?

 b) Why is it important for the speaker to get the sense of the talk?

 c) What are the main points in this outline?

 d) Which main point conveys the thrust of the outline, and why?

 e) What are the sub points under the heading “How the Resurrection Helps Us”?

 f) How do you determine which sub points to develop more fully?

 g) Why should we avoid reading too many scriptures?

 h) How do you determine which scriptures to use?  


As part of our preparation, what are some good questions to ask ourselves?


Why is an extemporaneous delivery better than one that follows the outline word for word?


Why might it be beneficial to solicit counsel from the auxiliary counselor or other elders?


Why should we keep improving our ability to teach? (Re 4:11)

Questions




How does Jehovah feel about each of his servants? (Hag 2:7; Joh 5:20) What lesson should elders draw from this?

How did Jesus demonstrate that he wanted to help his disciples reach their full potential?


In what ways does Jehovah’s organization train appointed men today?

Why is delegating an essential part of training?

Why is it important to provide assistance to those who previously served as elders or ministerial servants?


In what ways could young sisters be encouraged? (Ps 68:11; Tit 2:3, 4)

How deep is Jesus’ love for the sheep? (Mt 9:36; Joh 10:11)


How does 2 Corinthians 11:23-29 indicate that Paul was a self-sacrificing shepherd?


Who is it your primary responsibility to shepherd? Why? (1Ti 3:4; 5:8)


How would application of the following scriptures contribute to a strong family? (Ac 17:11; Eph 6:18; Col 4:2; Jas 5:16; Pr 15:28; Heb 10:23; Heb 13:15; De 6:6, 7)

How can overseers help elderly publishers? Why and how should we assist the weak and inactive? (Pr 3:27; Mt 18:14; Ro 15:1, 2)


Why should loving shepherds keep up-to-date on information related to medical matters?


What important caution should we remember when shepherding sisters? Why?

Sovereignty-How Does It Affect You?


References




it-2 1008-1012




Questions




Define sovereignty. What other word conveys the underlying idea of sovereignty? (See 2 Chronicles 20:6 and references under Sovereignty in the Reference Bible Footnote Words Indexed)


Give reasons why Jehovah is the rightful Universal Sovereign. (Job 41:11; Ps 24:1; Re 4:11)


How do God’s qualities inspire confidence in his sovereignty? (De 32:4; 1Jo 4:8)


How was Jehovah's sovereignty challenged? What was challenged and what was not challenged?


What questions would have been unanswered if God had chosen to settle in Eden?


What further challenge does the book of Job reveal?


Highlight key points from Insight on the Scriptures, Volume 2, “Sovereignty.”

  a) “Earthly Rulers” and “God's Son as King”

  b) “Jehovah's Sovereignty Challenged” and “What God wants in those who serve him”

  c) “A failure to develop love and appreciation”

  d) “The point at issue” and “What was ‘the tree of the knowledge of good and bad’?”

  e) “God's servants charged with selfishness” and “Settlement of the issue, a vital need”

  f) “A moral issue” and “How far the issue reached”

  g) “Jesus Christ, Vindicator of the righteousness of Jehovah’s sovereignty” and “Others who uphold Jehovah’s side”  


Explain opportunities you have to demonstrate your attitude toward Jehovah's sovereignty, as indicated in the following scriptures. (Mt 24:45-47; 1Co 5:9-13; 7:39; Heb 13:17)


Describe “loyalty” as it is used in the Bible.


How is it possible for imperfect humans to prove that they are truly loyal to Jehovah? (Ge 6:22; 12:4; Ex 7:6; Da 3:14-18)


Why must we constantly be on the alert as to our attitude toward Jehovah’s sovereignty?


At the end of Christ’s Thousand Year Reign, what test will come on all humankind? (Re 20:7-9)


Why will the issue of universal sovereignty never need to be settled again? (1Co 15:24-28)
